com.cyc.kb

Interface KbPredicate

  • All Superinterfaces:
    KbIndividual, KbObject, KbObject.KbObjectWithArity, KbTerm, Relation
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BinaryPredicate
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BinaryPredicateWrapper, KbPredicateWrapper

    public interface KbPredicate
extends Relation
    The interface for Cyc predicates. KbPredicates are applied to one or more arguments to form a non-atomic Sentence.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.cyc.kb.KbObject

        KbObject.KbObjectWithArity

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.cyc.kb.KbObject

      <O> Collection<O> getValuesForArgPosition(Object arg, int argPosition, int valuePosition, Context ctx)
      This method gets all facts for the predicate that have arg at the thisArgPos arg position of the fact, as visible from ctx, and returns as O objects based on the arguments in the getArgPos argument position of the facts.
      <O> Collection<O> getValuesForArgPositionWithMatchArg(Object arg, int argPosition, int valuePosition, Object matchArg, int matchArgPos, Context ctx)
      This method gets all facts visible from ctx that use the predicate, have arg in the argPosition, and also have matchArg in the matchArgPos arg position; it returns a list of O objects from the valuePosition argument position of the fact.
      Boolean isAsserted(Context ctx, Object... args)
      Is there an assertion in ctx with a sentence using pred, with this in the thisArgPos argument position, and with the arguments in otherArgs as the rest of its arguments? This method will not throw exceptions.
      boolean isGeneralizationOf(KbPredicate moreSpecific, Context ctx)
      Determine whether this is a generalization of moreSpecific in the context ctx.

      • addSpecialization

        KbPredicate addSpecialization(KbPredicate moreSpecific,
                              Context ctx)
                       throws KbTypeException,
                              CreateException
        creates a new Fact stating that this is a more specific predicate than moreSpecific in the specified context. Essentially, it asserts (#$genlPreds moreSpecific this)

        genlPreds relates a predicate to its generalization. Any sentence that is true with a given predicate in argument position zero, is also true with the predicate replaced by its generalization.

        Parameters:
        ctx - the context where the fact is asserted
        moreSpecific - the specialization (predicate) of this KbPredicate
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KbTypeException

        Returns:

      • getGeneralizationSentence

        Sentence getGeneralizationSentence(KbPredicate moreGeneral)
                            throws KbTypeException,
                                   CreateException
        This method returns the Sentence (#$genlPreds this moreGeneral). The key difference between this and that, this method does not make any assertion in the KB. The sentence form of the assertion is generally useful when seeking user feedback before asserting into the KB. Use Sentence.assertIn(com.cyc.kb.Context) to assert the sentence in a Context.
        Parameters:
        moreGeneral - the more general predicate of this
        Returns:
        the sentence (#$genlPreds this moreGeneral)
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

      • getInverseGeneralizationSentence

        Sentence getInverseGeneralizationSentence(KbPredicate moreGeneral)
                                   throws KbTypeException,
                                          CreateException
        This method returns the Sentence (#$genlInverse this moreGeneral). The sentence form of the assertion is generally useful when seeking user feedback before asserting into the KB. Use Sentence.assertIn(com.cyc.kb.Context) to assert the sentence in a Context.
        Parameters:
        moreGeneral - the more general predicate of this
        Returns:
        the sentence (#$genlInverse this moreGeneral)
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

        KbPredicate addGeneralization(KbPredicate moreGeneral,
                              Context ctx)
                       throws KbTypeException,
                              CreateException
        creates a new Fact stating that moreGeneral is a more general predicate than this in the context. Essentially, this asserts (genlPreds this moreGeneral)

        Parameters:
        moreGeneral - the KbPredicate that is to become more general than this
        ctx - the context where the fact is asserted
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KbTypeException

      • isGeneralizationOf

        boolean isGeneralizationOf(KbPredicate moreSpecific,
                           Context ctx)
        Determine whether this is a generalization of moreSpecific in the context ctx. Essentially, this amounts to determining whether (#$genlPreds moreSpecific this) is true. Note that (#$genlPreds moreSpecific this) need not be asserted to be true.
        Parameters:
        moreSpecific - the possibly more specific predicate
        ctx - the context of query
        Returns:
        true if (#$genlPreds moreSpecific this) is true

      • getExtent

        List<Fact> getExtent()

      • getExtent

      • addFact

        Fact addFact(Context ctx,
             Object... args)
      throws KbTypeException,
             CreateException
        Finds or creates a new Fact in the underlying KB

        The method finds a Fact in the KB with predicate pred, and this at the argument position thisArgPos, in the context ctx. The otherArgs specify all the arguments of the Fact, completely. If the fact specified by the input arguments is not found, creates and persists a new fact in the underlying KB.

        Note: Not all subclasses of the KB objects are directly assertible. For example, Sentence, Variable and Symbol need to be quoted, using Quote method, before they can participate in closed assertions.

        Note: The context is the first argument in methods that have variable number of arguments. In all other methods, context is the last argument.

        Parameters:
        ctx - the context of the fact
        args - the arguments to the predicate. They must be KbObjects or Java objects such as Date, int, float, String.
        Returns:
        the fact found or created
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

      • getFact

        Fact getFact(Context ctx,
             Object... args)
      throws KbTypeException,
             CreateException
        find the specific existing Fact, in ctx, that has pred as its predicate, this in the thisArgPos argument position, and otherArgs as its other arguments. Effectively, this is inserted into position thisArgPos of otherArgs to form the arguments for a Fact that is searched for in the KB. If an assertion using that sentence is found in the context, the Fact is returned. If no such assertion is found, appropriate exception is thrown. Note: The context is the first argument in methods that have variable number of arguments. In all other methods, context is the last argument.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context of the fact
        args - the arguments to the predicate. They must be KbObjects or Java objects such as Date, int, float, String.
        Returns:
        the fact represented by the parameters in context ctx
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KbTypeException

      • getFacts

        Collection<Fact> getFacts(Object arg,
                          int argPosition,
                          Context ctx)
        Gets the asserted Facts visible from ctx, using the predicate predicate with this at position thisArgPos of the Fact
        Parameters:
        arg - the Predicate of the returned fact
        argPosition - the position where this is found in the fact
        ctx - the Context. If null, returns facts from the default context DefaultContext.forQuery()
        Returns:
        a collection of facts, empty if none are found

      • isAsserted

        Boolean isAsserted(Context ctx,
                   Object... args)
        Is there an assertion in ctx with a sentence using pred, with this in the thisArgPos argument position, and with the arguments in otherArgs as the rest of its arguments? This method will not throw exceptions. Effectively, this is a wrapper around #getFact(com.cyc.kb.Context, com.cyc.kb.KbPredicate, int, java.lang.Object...) that returns false if there are any exceptions.

        Note: The context is the first argument in methods that have variable number of arguments. In all other methods, context is the last argument.

        Parameters:
        ctx - the context in which the sentence is asserted
        args - the arguments to the predicate. They must be KbObjects or Java objects such as Date, int, float, String.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the fact is determined to be true

      • getSentence

        Sentence getSentence(Object... args)
              throws KbTypeException,
                     CreateException
        Constructs a Sentence, that has pred as its predicate, this in the thisArgPos argument position, and otherArgs as its other arguments. Effectively, this is inserted into position thisArgPos of otherArgs to form the sentence.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments to the predicate. They must be KbObjects or Java objects such as Date, int, float, String.
        Returns:
        the sentence constructed by the parameters
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

      • getValuesForArgPosition

        <O> Collection<O> getValuesForArgPosition(Object arg,
                                          int argPosition,
                                          int valuePosition,
                                          Context ctx)
        This method gets all facts for the predicate that have arg at the thisArgPos arg position of the fact, as visible from ctx, and returns as O objects based on the arguments in the getArgPos argument position of the facts.
        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the objects returned
        Parameters:
        arg - the predicate of the facts
        argPosition - the argument position of this object in the candidate facts
        valuePosition - the argument position of the returned objects in the candidate facts
        ctx - the context where the facts are found. If null, returns facts from the default context DefaultContext.forQuery()
        Returns:
        a collection of objects of type O
        See Also:
        for a method that returns the facts, rather than just the objects at a specific argument position of the facts, getValuesForArgPositionWithMatchArg(java.lang.Object, int, int, java.lang.Object, int, com.cyc.kb.Context), BinaryPredicate.getValuesForArg(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object, com.cyc.kb.Context)

      • getValuesForArgPositionWithMatchArg

        <O> Collection<O> getValuesForArgPositionWithMatchArg(Object arg,
                                                      int argPosition,
                                                      int valuePosition,
                                                      Object matchArg,
                                                      int matchArgPos,
                                                      Context ctx)
        This method gets all facts visible from ctx that use the predicate, have arg in the argPosition, and also have matchArg in the matchArgPos arg position; it returns a list of O objects from the valuePosition argument position of the fact.
        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the objects returned
        Parameters:
        arg - the predicate of the facts
        argPosition - the argument position of this in the candidate facts
        valuePosition - the argument position of the returned objects in the candidate facts
        matchArg - the object in the argument position matchArgPos
        matchArgPos - the argument position that must be filled with matchArg
        ctx - the context. If null, returns facts from the default context DefaultContext.forQuery()
        Returns:
        a collection of objects of type O
        See Also:
        getValuesForArgPosition(java.lang.Object, int, int, com.cyc.kb.Context), BinaryPredicate.getValuesForArg(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object, com.cyc.kb.Context)
